description: ## Overview Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Heap-based Buffer Overflow via the `XISendDeviceHierarchyEvent` function. An attacker can cause an application crash or execute arbitrary code by adding certain new device IDs to the `xXIHierarchyInfo` struct, which leads to exceeding the allocated array length and triggering a heap buffer overflow condition. ## Remediation Upgrade `xorg-server` to version 21.1.11, 23.2.4 or higher. ## References - [Gitlab Commit](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/xorg/xserver/-/commit/6236342157b9ddc9a4ebb3438e469a8cb37eaecb) - [Gitlab Commit](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/xorg/xserver/-/commit/7efd09cdb13ae1a4100f68a11947afe581fa1ee8) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2256540)
remediation: Upgrade xorg-server to version 21.1.11, 23.2.4 or higher.
title: Heap-based Buffer Overflow
